attributes.action: Re-open churches for the purpose of prayer.
attributes.additional_details: It is a common belief: humans are more than mere physical entities.  We have physical, social, psychological and spiritual needs.  Spiritual needs often surface during crises and, particularly, at end of life; UK and international palliative care guidelines indicate this.  Unmet spiritual needs cause spiritual distress and unnecessary suffering.  Many distressed humans desire to pray; by opening churches for 'lighting candles' and for prayer can greatly ease the burden of isolation and lockdown.
attributes.background: Allow churches to re-open for individual prayer.  To reconsider allowing small groups to meet for prayer where social-distancing is possible.
